author: Adam Pranda
comment: Since my LG Watch Sport updated to Oreo, I can no longer connect using EAP in a university network to other than the original router. For example, if I setup the network in Location A, the watch connects correctly, but if I move to Location B with the same network present, the watch will refuse to connect (status of network remains at "Saved"). The opposite scenario (setup in B successfully and then move to A) also yields the same result.

reply.author: appfour
reply.content: We will look into it. Thank you for your feedback.

comment: Doesn't work for me on Asus Zenwatch 3.  All I see is two access points marked "disabled" and the Play Store link to buy the full version.  It does show some details about the AP but when it tries to connect I see "Obtaining IP Address" then just "Saved", and it doesn't connect.  I'm happy to buy full versions of apps if the free one does what the description says.

author: Eric Beck
comment: Works OK but really needs to be able to connect to open wifi hotspots that require you to go to a web page to agree to the terms before you can complete the login.  Very limited value without the functionality.  I should be able to pop in to Starbucks or Barns & Nobel and connect to their wifi.  This is such a basic feature.  Not sure why it's not possible with the app.?...and why it's not native to Android Wear.

author: Jorge Gomez
comment: Signing in to a captive portal only works for wear 1.x not 2.0 do not buy full version

reply.author: appfour
reply.content:
This is a Google issue as you can follow here: https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/38374958 
We also make our users aware in the description, plus ... we would refund if something is not working properly. So no risk in just giving the full version a try. Contact support@appfour.com if you encounter any issues.

reply.content: Please apologize the inconvenience. Due to changes from Google this feature is currently not working on Android Wear 2 devices.  https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/38374958  As soon as this issue is fixed, captive portals will be supported again.

author: Gene Saadi
comment: Very impressive!

author: Farkas Gabor
comment: I don't know who these guys are, but they must be geniuses! Whenever they show up with a new app I think "well... just another Android Wear app. I don't think it'll do anything new to my watch." Then BAAAM! I install it and I realize that this is the function I definitely needed on my watch! It's unbelievable. I can't believe that Google didn't include these apps originally on their Android Watches because they are SO useful and a must have! For example their Wear Mail app. How else could you read and reply to your emails on your watch without a phone? Or their Wear Calendar app! How else could you view and even edit events and add new entries on your watch without phone? Other apps are not able to do that! The Wifi Manager is also very helpful, because with that you can login to other (not saved) Wifi networks without your phone when you are on the go! Their Wear Weather app is also one of my favorites! It's very simple but surprisingly accurate and REALLY works. Other weather apps for Android Wear maybe look fancier but they keep forgetting settings, units changing back to Fahrenheit from Celsius, etc... Very frustrating to use them. But appfour's weather app works like a charm!
